availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Father of Simeon Lawson and Nancy Lawson. Married to Penelope Gatewood Lawson in Hancock County, Kentucky, on December 15, 1840. Father of James Lawson, Patrick Lawson, Martha Lawson, Frederick Lawson, Michael Lawson, and Nina Lawson. Resident of Hancock County in 1840. Owned one enslaved person in Hancock County in 1840. Farmer in Hancock County in 1850. Employed Bazil Taylor as a laborer in Hancock County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Hancock County in 1850. Farmer in Hancock County in 1860. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Hancock County in 1860, including Hetty Ann [Unknown], Isaac [Unknown], and Amanda Ann [Unknown]. Owned Annie [Unknown] in 1861.

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994037, Hancock County Births.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Hancock County Marriages, Film #000495729.
